amendment.description: An amendment numbered 6 printed in Part B of House Report 116-383 to stipulate that if a credit scoring agency changes their model s uch that it may negatively impact the credit scores for a group of consumers, then the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has the option to review the new model and prohibit the change if they find the change is inappropriate.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 6 printed in Part B of House Report 116-383 to stipulate that if a credit scoring agency changes their model s uch that it may negatively impact the credit scores for a group of consumers, then the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has the option to review the new model and prohibit the change if they find the change is inappropriate.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Gottheimer amendment (A006) Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A006) offered by Mr. Gottheimer.
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Gottheimer amendment (A006) Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
